en: BOB: the tree and prop replacer
UNDER DEVELOPMENT: Replaces trees and props.
All props of this type in these buildings
All props of this type in all buildings
All trees of this type in these buildings
All trees of this type in all buildings
All props of this type in these networks
All props of this type in all networks
All trees of this type in these networks
All trees of this type in all networks
Revert is not available as there is no active replacement for this item
Hide this item (sets probability to zero)
If this is selected then the specified custom height offset will be used (instead of using the default prop height)
A replacement is currently applied for these buildings
A replacement is currently applied for all buildings
A replacement is currently applied for these networks
A replacement is currently applied for all networks
A replacement pack is currently applied
Pack cannot be applied as it conflicts with an already-applied pack
Use selected configuration (instead of global configuration) for this save
Removes any references to unloaded buildings, networks, props and/or trees from the current configuration file
Removes records of replaced standalone trees and props from the current savegame.  Will mean that you can no longer revert map replacements (does NOT affect props or trees in buildings or networks)
Changes will take effect on restart
Please refer to the mod's Steam Workshop page for further information.
This means that the mod is not able to operate and has shut down.
BOB, the tree and prop replacer, was unable to complete its required Harmony patches.
Possible causes of this problem include:
The required Harmony 2 mod dependency was not installed
An old and/or broken mod is preventing Harmony 2 from operating properly
Introducing map tree replacement! Activate the BOB tool as usual and click on a free-standing tree.
Fix intermittent building replacement panel exception when changing target item.
Fix potential race conditions on game load
Fix probability refresh when reverting TO an all-building or all-network replacement
Fix LODs not refreshing after reverting all-network or all-building replacements
Adjust info panel textfield labels to fit longer translation strings
Initial implementation of network replacement packs
Now properly compatible with Network Skins 2
New tree/prop list layout, with icons to indicate which type of replacement is active
Add configurations management for handling multiple different configuration files, accessible through the options panel
Can now select networks in buildings
Add ascending/descending name sort filters to lists
Add ability to remove terrain ruining from all trees and/or props (in the options panel)
Ferry paths are now selectable (to change/hide those ferry path marker buoys)
Fix network prop angles sometimes being incorrectly displayed on selection
Add option to make wires in networks (power lines and railway catenaries) more realistically sized
Changes are now previewed in real-time
Change to User Interface: choose between replacement modes before applying changes
Change to User Interface: a dedicated 'hide' button to automatically set probabilities to zero
Translation framework has been updated to use CrowdIn
Trees no longer have an angle setting, as this will always be overridden by any mod implementing random tree rotation
Improve handling of props with special attributes
Other minor UI and functional improvements
